intro: Lepidaploa pari, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom in spring and are followed by small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Lepidaploa pari is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
